Authors:
Hai-Yan Song, Ying-Jin Huang, Ping-An Zhong, Jiang-Lin
Liao, Zhao-Hai Wang, Dian-Ming Hu
Title:
Junewangia aquatica (Junewangiaceae), a new species from
freshwater habitats in China.
Keywords:
Acrodictys, Ascomycota, dematiaceous hyphomycetes,
taxonomy, phylogeny
Abstract:
Junewangia aquatica sp. nov., a new Acrodictys-like fungus
was collected on submerged wood from freshwater habitats in Yunnan
Province, China. J. aquatica is characterized by its flared
conidiophores with percurrent proliferations, monoblastic, terminal or
intercalary, cylindrical conidiogenous cells, and subglobose to broadly
ellipsoidal conidia with transverse and oblique septa. A phylogenetic
tree of Acrodictys-like species was inferred from multi-locus (SSU, ITS
and LSU) sequences. A key to the species of Junewangia is provided.
